chargeHist.descr: Battery to Law Enforcement Officers, Fire Fighters or Commission Wardens

result.execSummary:
The defendant Anne E Kowal was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Resisting or Obstructing an Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).
  • Battery, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).
  • Battery, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

**02/24/16-Judge Jeffrey A. Conen**
Defendant to spend 30 days straight time, with no good time credit, as condition time in the House of Correction for said Defendant's non-compliance with conditions of probation. Defendant Remanded.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Anne E Kowal in court pro se.  Alex Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Bridgette Korhonen appeared for the Department of Corrections.

Matter here for a review hearing.  The Department and the Defendant indicated that the Defendant is back on track.  The Defendant is complying with her probation orders.  The Court continues to stay the condition time.  No action taken at this time and no further action taken.
Deputy Court Clerk tg
Probation Status Review, received and filed.

Defendant Anne E Kowal in court.  Catelin Ringersma for Alex Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Probation Agent Bridgette Korhonen present in court.  Deputy Court Clerk: KAR.
Case calendared for review hearing.  Probation agent reports that defendant is currently complying with supervision.  Court ordered case adjourned for review hearing in Branch 30.  Review hearing scheduled for July 25, 2016 at 08:30 am.
Probation Status Review, received and filed.
For 30 days condition time in HOC for non-compliance with probation conditions.
for Commitment for Condition Time for Non-Compliance with Probation Conditions, signed and filed.

Defendant Anne E Kowal in court with Attorney Christopher Paul Ehrfurth.  Alex T. Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Bridgette Korhonen appeared for the Department of Corrections.

Matter here for a review hearing.  The Defendant has not been complying with probation conditions or her probation officer.  Arguments heard.  The Court orders THIRTY (30) days STRAIGHT TIME.  Court ordered defendant REMANDED into the custody of the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department.  Matter set for a review hearing on May 31, 2016 at 1:30pm in Br. 30, Judge Conen's court.
Deputy Court Clerk tg
Probation Status Review, received and filed.
Bail Refund Check Packet
10/6/15 bail refund notice/affidavit mailed to surety.

Defendant Anne E Kowal in court with Attorney Christopher Paul Ehrfurth.  Sara Nicole Volden Schroeder appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  STATE IN COMPLIANCE WITH VICTIM NOTIFICATION. 

Sentencing proceeded. Statements made by state, defense counsel, and defendant.  

AS TO COUNT #1:  THE COURT ORDERED the defendant to serve NINE (9) months in the House of Correction CONSECUTIVE STRAIGHT TIME.  THE COURT STAYED THE SENTENCE and placed the defendant on PROBATION for a period of TWO (2) years with supervision by Wisconsin Department of Corrections.

AS TO COUNT #3:  THE COURT ORDERED the defendant to serve NINE (9) months in the House of Correction.  THE COURT STAYED THE SENTENCE and placed the defendant on PROBATION for a period of TWO (2) years CONCURRENT to Count #1 with supervision by Wisconsin Department of Corrections.

AS TO COUNT #4:  THE COURT ORDERED the defendant to serve NINE (9) months in the House of Correction.  THE COURT STAYED THE SENTENCE and placed the defendant on PROBATION for a period of TWO (2) years CONCURRENT to Count #3 with supervision by Wisconsin Department of Corrections.

The Court ordered SIX (6) months condition time issued and stayed to be used at the Court's or Department of Corrections' discretion.  The Court ordered a report from the Department of Corrections on how the Defendant is doing on probation.

The Court ordered that costs and surcharges are to come out of the bail that is on deposit.  The balance can be mailed to the surety.

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:
* Pay all applicable court costs and supervision fees.
* Absolute soberity, random urine screens, possess no illegal drugs.
* Attend an AODA treatment program as determined by the agent.
* Obtain and maintain suitable employment.
* Perform FIFTY (50) HOURS of community service.

The Court set this matter for a review hearing on February 24, 2016 at 8:30am in Br. 30, Judge Conen's court.
Deputy Court Clerk tg
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.
Count #1 was Amended to Resisting an Officer, 946.41(1) and 939.51(3)(a)

Defendant Anne E Kowal in court with attorney Christopher Paul Ehrfurth.  Sara Nicole Volden Schroeder appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Matter here for a plea hearing.  AS TO COUNTS #1, #3 AND #4:    Defendant advised of constitutional rights and of maximum penalties, waived all rights and plead NO CONTEST.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights, Jury Instructions and Addendum to Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights, received and filed.  Stipulation by state and defense to complaint as factual basis to sustain plea.  Court found defendant guilty and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.  

Court advised defendant if she is not a citizen of the United States of America, that upon a plea no contest for this offense, she could be deported, excluded from admission to his country, or denied naturalization under federal law.  

AS TO COUNTS #2 AND #5:  Pursuant to plea negotiations and on State's motion, Court orders COUNTS #2 AND #3 DISMISSED and read-in for purposes of sentencing.

The Court VACATES the Jury Trial date of September 2, 2015 at 9:00am.  Matter set for a sentencing hearing on October 1, 2015 at 8:30am in Br. 30, Judge Conen's court.

Defendant Anne E Kowal in court with attorney Christopher Paul Ehrfurth.  Patrick J Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Final pre-trial scheduled for August 26, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Anne E Kowal in court with attorney Christopher Paul Ehrfurth.  Sara Nicole Volden Schroeder appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  For reasons stated on the record, defense counsel requested an adjournment of the 6/24/15 trial date.  State did not object.  Court granted defense request and ordered the 6/24/15 trial date vacated.  New trial date and final pretrial date selected.  If any motions are to be filed, movant must file by 7/06/15; response due by 7/21/15; reply due by 7/27/15.  All motions in limine, jury instructions and witness lists are due by August 3, 2015.  Parties were advised that as of August 1, 2015, this calendar will be transferred to Judge Stephanie G. Rothstein, Branch 25, in Room G55 of the Criminal Justice Facility.    Request for Substitution of Judge received and filed.  Court consented to substitution against Judge Rothstein.  Parties are advised the Clerk of Circuit Court reassigned case pursuant to current court rules to Judge Dennis Cimpl, Br. 19 in Room 313 of the Safety Building.  Court ordered all terms and conditions of bail to continue.  Final pre-trial scheduled for August 4, 2015 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for September 2, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Anne E Kowal in court with attorney Jeffrey J. Szczewski for attorney Christopher Paul Ehrfurth.  Francesco Mineo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense counsel requested a trial date.  Court set the following schedule: movant to file any motions by 5/28/15; response due by 6/08/15; reply due by 6/13/15.  All motions in limine, jury instructions and witness lists are due within one (1) week of the final pretrial date.  Any alibi notices must be filed per statute.  Court ordered all terms and conditions of bail to continue.  Final pre-trial scheduled for June 19, 2015 at 08:30 am.  Motion hearing scheduled for June 19, 2015 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for June 24, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Anne E Kowal in court with attorney Christopher Paul Ehrfurth.  Sara Nicole Volden Schroeder appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense counsel requested another date to do further investigation; State did not object.  Court allowed ONE more scheduling date and ordered all terms and conditions of bail to continue.  Scheduling conference scheduled for May 18, 2015 at 08:30 am.
